author: emansipater
content: Does anyone have a roughly parameterized model of the subfinality economic guarantees we get out of the beacon chain?  E.g. if you get x blocks of confirmation on something (say, reporting a slashing event), at a particular # of total validators and participation rate, how much "economic commitment" has there been to that outcome remaining that way rather than getting forked?

author: emansipater
content: This seems like an important tool for measuring the security effectiveness of the beacon chain, especially when comparing it with PoW

author: tot.macher
content: does anyone know which will be the long-term stable eth2 testnet? pyrmont, medalla, etc?

author: protolambda
content:
Medalla is on an older spec version and will be deprecated. For now it has so many users that we are not stopping support just yet. Priority goes to new testnets and mainnet however.
Pyrmont was originally thought of as a final stress-test, to see the clients perform and improve before mainnet. At the same time, users can try v1 on this testnet.
We could keep Pyrmont up and running for longer, there are different opinions about this. Something I'd like to have long-term is a better testnet UX: faster validator entry/exit, so participating is not as slow and difficult.

author: protolambda
content: For now I think we will focus on Pyrmont before mainnet, and then reconsider launching a new long-term testnet afterwards.
